column2: JUDGE COMMUTES 2 LIFE SENTENCES FOR MOB BOSS WHO BECAME INFORMER
column3: NEW YORK - When Joseph C. Massino took the witness stand in 2011, becoming the first official boss of one of New York’s five crime families to break the code of silence and testify against a former confederate, he offered a succinct explanation for his departure from mob tradition.

column2: JUDGE COMMUTES 2 LIFE SENTENCES FOR MOB BOSS WHO BECAME INFORMER
column3: “I’m hoping to see a light at the end of the tunnel,” he said.

column2: JUDGE COMMUTES 2 LIFE SENTENCES FOR MOB BOSS WHO BECAME INFORMER
column3: On Wednesday, the tunnel got a whole lot shorter: A federal judge commuted Massino’s sentence of two consecutive life terms in prison.

column2: JUDGE COMMUTES 2 LIFE SENTENCES FOR MOB BOSS WHO BECAME INFORMER
column3: Massino, the former boss of the Bonanno crime family, will be released from federal custody in 60 days, a period the government requested to put in place security arrangements to keep Massino safe from what are presumed to be a considerable number of enemies.

column2: JUDGE COMMUTES 2 LIFE SENTENCES FOR MOB BOSS WHO BECAME INFORMER
column3: Federal prosecutors in Brooklyn had sought a reduction of Massino’s sentence, citing his extensive cooperation: While incarcerated, Massino had recorded conversations with a Mafia captain, and he has provided investigators with information about hundreds of people associated with not only the Bonanno family, which Massino took control of in 1991, but also the other crime families across New York.

column2: JUDGE COMMUTES 2 LIFE SENTENCES FOR MOB BOSS WHO BECAME INFORMER
column3: At a brief hearing in U.S. District Court in Brooklyn on Wednesday, Judge Nicholas G. Garaufis credited the government’s arguments and decided to undo the sentence of two life terms that he had originally meted out to Massino.

column2: JUDGE COMMUTES 2 LIFE SENTENCES FOR MOB BOSS WHO BECAME INFORMER
column3: When that sentence was handed down, in 2005, clapping could be heard in his courtroom.

column2: JUDGE COMMUTES 2 LIFE SENTENCES FOR MOB BOSS WHO BECAME INFORMER
column3: But on Wednesday, the judge said that in deciding to free Massino after more than 10 years of incarceration, he had considered the aging mobster’s “extraordinary cooperation with the government and his willingness to place himself at grave personal risk.”

column2: JUDGE COMMUTES 2 LIFE SENTENCES FOR MOB BOSS WHO BECAME INFORMER
column3: Once released, Massino will probably receive a new identity and live elsewhere in the United States, his lawyer, Edward A. McDonald, said after the hearing.

column2: JUDGE COMMUTES 2 LIFE SENTENCES FOR MOB BOSS WHO BECAME INFORMER
column3: McDonald said that Massino could support himself on rental income from his property and that he was also eligible for Social Security income.

column2: JUDGE COMMUTES 2 LIFE SENTENCES FOR MOB BOSS WHO BECAME INFORMER
column3: Garaufis said that Massino, a rotund man of 70 whose health is failing, “may be the most important cooperator in the modern history of law enforcement efforts to prosecute the American Mafia.” He said that Massino’s assistance was essential in the investigations of the four leaders of the Bonanno family who followed him.

column2: JUDGE COMMUTES 2 LIFE SENTENCES FOR MOB BOSS WHO BECAME INFORMER
column3: The judge also noted that Massino’s willingness to turn informer “has almost certainly caused numerous other members of organized crime to cooperate with the government.”

column2: JUDGE COMMUTES 2 LIFE SENTENCES FOR MOB BOSS WHO BECAME INFORMER
column3: Massino’s own crimes received only passing mention on Wednesday.

column2: JUDGE COMMUTES 2 LIFE SENTENCES FOR MOB BOSS WHO BECAME INFORMER
column3: He has been convicted of eight murders, including those of several rivals in the Bonanno family.

column2: JUDGE COMMUTES 2 LIFE SENTENCES FOR MOB BOSS WHO BECAME INFORMER
column3: Massino, who wore a two-toned sweatsuit, said little during the hearing, leaving most of the speaking to his lawyer.

column2: JUDGE COMMUTES 2 LIFE SENTENCES FOR MOB BOSS WHO BECAME INFORMER
column3: But Massino did offer a brief statement of remorse, which he delivered standing in a single breath, and then quickly sat down.

column2: JUDGE COMMUTES 2 LIFE SENTENCES FOR MOB BOSS WHO BECAME INFORMER
column3: “I pray every night for forgiveness of everyone I hurt, especially the victims’ families,” he said.

column2: JUDGE COMMUTES 2 LIFE SENTENCES FOR MOB BOSS WHO BECAME INFORMER
column3: A prosecutor, Taryn A. Merkl, said that the government had reached out to the families of Massino’s victims to inquire if any wanted to make a statement in court, but had not received any responses.

column2: JUDGE COMMUTES 2 LIFE SENTENCES FOR MOB BOSS WHO BECAME INFORMER
column3: Merkl said that nothing about the government’s decision to take Massino’s side “apologizes or condones the life he led, yet at the same time he decided to make a change.”

column2: JUDGE COMMUTES 2 LIFE SENTENCES FOR MOB BOSS WHO BECAME INFORMER
column3: Details of the life Massino will lead after his release were scarce.

column2: JUDGE COMMUTES 2 LIFE SENTENCES FOR MOB BOSS WHO BECAME INFORMER
column3: Garaufis directed Massino to continue to cooperate with the government, noting that prosecutors had informed him that Massino was helping with a number of investigations that were still pending.

column2: JUDGE COMMUTES 2 LIFE SENTENCES FOR MOB BOSS WHO BECAME INFORMER
column3: Garaufis said Massino’s age and ill health reduced “the court’s concern about possible recidivism.” Nonetheless, he ordered that Massino not associate “for the rest of your life” with known organized crime figures.

column2: JUDGE COMMUTES 2 LIFE SENTENCES FOR MOB BOSS WHO BECAME INFORMER
column3: McDonald would not comment on the nature of his client’s health ailments, except to say that Massino often said he “had everything except cancer.”

column2: JUDGE COMMUTES 2 LIFE SENTENCES FOR MOB BOSS WHO BECAME INFORMER
column3: McDonald described his client as “a stoic guy,” but said Massino often told him that “if he had to make the decision again, if he was 18 or 19 years old, he wouldn’t go into the Mafia.”

column2: FAMILY PLANNING OFFICIALS INVESTIGATE CHINESE FILM DIRECTOR
column3: Sue-Lin Wong contributed research.

column2: FAMILY PLANNING OFFICIALS INVESTIGATE CHINESE FILM DIRECTOR
column3: BEIJING – China’s most celebrated film director, Zhang Yimou, is being investigated for a potential violation of family planning laws, an official said Thursday, confirming reports in state news media.

column2: FAMILY PLANNING OFFICIALS INVESTIGATE CHINESE FILM DIRECTOR
column3: Family planning officials are examining discussions on the Internet that say Zhang has fathered up to seven children with four women.

column2: FAMILY PLANNING OFFICIALS INVESTIGATE CHINESE FILM DIRECTOR
column3: If he is found to have violated the laws, he could be fined nearly $27 million because the fines are based on the offender’s income, according to a report in the online edition of People’s Daily, the official mouthpiece of the Communist Party.

column2: FAMILY PLANNING OFFICIALS INVESTIGATE CHINESE FILM DIRECTOR
column3: An official in a propaganda office attached to the family planning committee of Jiangsu province, near Shanghai on the east coast, confirmed the substance of the People’s Daily report, which was published Wednesday.

column2: FAMILY PLANNING OFFICIALS INVESTIGATE CHINESE FILM DIRECTOR
column3: Calls to the family planning committee of Wuxi, the city where Chen Ting, Zhang’s second wife, is registered as a resident, went unanswered Thursday.

column2: FAMILY PLANNING OFFICIALS INVESTIGATE CHINESE FILM DIRECTOR
column3: Family planning laws generally restrict families to one child, and fines are levied for additional children.

column2: FAMILY PLANNING OFFICIALS INVESTIGATE CHINESE FILM DIRECTOR
column3: There are numerous exceptions, though: Many rural families and ethnic minorities are allowed to have more than one child without penalty.

column2: FAMILY PLANNING OFFICIALS INVESTIGATE CHINESE FILM DIRECTOR
column3: Xinhua, the state news agency, said Thursday that the local family planning committee would release the results of its investigation into Zhang soon.

column2: FAMILY PLANNING OFFICIALS INVESTIGATE CHINESE FILM DIRECTOR
column3: Zhang’s most recent feature film was “The Flowers of War” starring Christian Bale; China entered it into the Oscar contest for best foreign film of 2011.

column2: FAMILY PLANNING OFFICIALS INVESTIGATE CHINESE FILM DIRECTOR
column3: Early in his career, Zhang made a string of films that became popular on the international film festival circuit and in foreign art theaters, including “Red Sorghum,” “Raise the Red Lantern” and “To Live,” adaptations of well-known literary works.

column2: FAMILY PLANNING OFFICIALS INVESTIGATE CHINESE FILM DIRECTOR
column3: He achieved commercial success with “Hero,” a martial arts film, and was commissioned by Communist Party leaders to direct the opening ceremony of the 2008 Olympics in Beijing.

column2: FAMILY PLANNING OFFICIALS INVESTIGATE CHINESE FILM DIRECTOR
column3: Zhang, 61, is a member of the Chinese People’s Political Consultative Conference, a sort of honorary legislature whose seats are often distributed by the party as political rewards.

column2: FAMILY PLANNING OFFICIALS INVESTIGATE CHINESE FILM DIRECTOR
column3: Zhang’s critics say he has changed over the years from a director with an uncompromising vision to one who bows to the whims of party officials.

column2: FAMILY PLANNING OFFICIALS INVESTIGATE CHINESE FILM DIRECTOR
column3: In an interview in Beijing with The New York Times published in 2012, Zhang said censorship “can’t be changed, and it will be there in the future.” He added: “Foreigners think that because I did the opening ceremony of the Olympics, I have certain privileges, but in fact it’s not like that at all.

column2: FAMILY PLANNING OFFICIALS INVESTIGATE CHINESE FILM DIRECTOR
column3: In front of censorship, everyone is equal.”

column2: FAMILY PLANNING OFFICIALS INVESTIGATE CHINESE FILM DIRECTOR
column3: Zhang could not be reached for comment Thursday.

column2: FAMILY PLANNING OFFICIALS INVESTIGATE CHINESE FILM DIRECTOR
column3: There has been a recent push by scholars to end the one-child policy, which critics say has led to forced abortions and sterilizations.

column2: FAMILY PLANNING OFFICIALS INVESTIGATE CHINESE FILM DIRECTOR
column3: Some economists say that China will face a dwindling pool of young workers in the coming years, and that it no longer makes sense to continue the policy.

column2: FAMILY PLANNING OFFICIALS INVESTIGATE CHINESE FILM DIRECTOR
column3: Furthermore, for economic reasons, the birthrate is falling across China, especially in urban areas.

column2: FAMILY PLANNING OFFICIALS INVESTIGATE CHINESE FILM DIRECTOR
column3: There is no reliable public report that gives the exact number of children Zhang has with Chen, an actress.

column2: FAMILY PLANNING OFFICIALS INVESTIGATE CHINESE FILM DIRECTOR
column3: The recent surge of interest among Chinese Internet users in Zhang’s children appeared to have begun Monday, when Southern Entertainment Weekly published an article that said the couple had two sons and a daughter.

column2: FAMILY PLANNING OFFICIALS INVESTIGATE CHINESE FILM DIRECTOR
column3: That assertion has not been independently confirmed and the article did not name the sources of the information.

column2: FAMILY PLANNING OFFICIALS INVESTIGATE CHINESE FILM DIRECTOR
column3: The reporter and a photographer camped outside Zhang’s many homes in Beijing, and the photographer followed a car of his to the airport and witnessed what appeared to be some family members emerging from the car, the article said.

column2: FAMILY PLANNING OFFICIALS INVESTIGATE CHINESE FILM DIRECTOR
column3: Zhang has a daughter with his first wife, Xiao Hua, whom he divorced around the time he was in a relationship with Gong Li, who starred in Zhang’s early films and became China’s best-known actress.

column2: FAMILY PLANNING OFFICIALS INVESTIGATE CHINESE FILM DIRECTOR
column3: The daughter, Zhang Mo, is about 30 and studied filmmaking at New York University.

column2: FAMILY PLANNING OFFICIALS INVESTIGATE CHINESE FILM DIRECTOR
column3: She has worked as a film editor for her father and was a translator for Bale on the set of “The Flowers of War.”

column2: FAMILY PLANNING OFFICIALS INVESTIGATE CHINESE FILM DIRECTOR
column3: The People’s Daily report said there was speculation that Zhang may have three other children with two other women, but it did not give their identities.

column2: BERLUSCONI SAYS PARTY TO BACK ITALY'S COALITION
column3: ROME - A visibly shaken Silvio Berlusconi, the former Italian prime minister, said Sunday that his center-right party would continue to support Italy’s fragile coalition government, releasing some of the political tension that has built in the country since a court upheld his conviction for tax fraud last week.

column2: BERLUSCONI SAYS PARTY TO BACK ITALY'S COALITION
column3: “We have said clearly and directly that the government must forge ahead and approve the economic measures that we have requested and were agreed,” Berlusconi said in his first public appearance since the conviction, speaking at a rally his party had organized in front of his residence here.

column2: BERLUSCONI SAYS PARTY TO BACK ITALY'S COALITION
column3: Italy’s prime minister, Enrico Letta, watched the rally on television and took note of Berlusconi’s intentions.

column2: BERLUSCONI SAYS PARTY TO BACK ITALY'S COALITION
column3: But he made clear that he expected concrete action, like support for a package of economic measures that are scheduled to be voted on in Parliament next week, a member of Letta’s staff said.

column2: BERLUSCONI SAYS PARTY TO BACK ITALY'S COALITION
column3: “I can promise you,” Berlusconi told his supporters, almost in tears.

column2: BERLUSCONI SAYS PARTY TO BACK ITALY'S COALITION
column3: “Here I am.

column2: BERLUSCONI SAYS PARTY TO BACK ITALY'S COALITION
column3: I am staying here.

column2: BERLUSCONI SAYS PARTY TO BACK ITALY'S COALITION
column3: I won’t surrender.”

column2: BERLUSCONI SAYS PARTY TO BACK ITALY'S COALITION
column3: An estimated 2,000 people attended the rally to express anger and bewilderment at the ruling.

column2: BERLUSCONI SAYS PARTY TO BACK ITALY'S COALITION
column3: “This party carries 10 million votes,” Raffaele Fitto, a former government minister from Berlusconi’s People of Liberty party, told the television network La7 from the rally.

column2: BERLUSCONI SAYS PARTY TO BACK ITALY'S COALITION
column3: “It cannot be canceled with a pen stroke.”

column2: BERLUSCONI SAYS PARTY TO BACK ITALY'S COALITION
column3: Last week, Italy’s highest court upheld a four-year prison sentence for Berlusconi, which had been effectively reduced to one year, for tax fraud.

column2: BERLUSCONI SAYS PARTY TO BACK ITALY'S COALITION
column3: He was found guilty of a plot in which his Mediaset broadcasting company bought the rights to show U.S. movies on their networks and inflated the prices, using offshore companies to evade taxes.

column2: BERLUSCONI SAYS PARTY TO BACK ITALY'S COALITION
column3: After the ruling, lawmakers from the People of Liberty party offered to resign and have been demanding that President Giorgio Napolitano pardon Berlusconi, but experts say that is highly unlikely.

column2: BERLUSCONI SAYS PARTY TO BACK ITALY'S COALITION
column3: By Oct. 15, Berlusconi must decide whether he prefers to serve his time in jail, under house arrest or do community service.

column2: MOUNTAINOUS ROOFTOP ADDITION DRAWS NOTICE IN BEIJING
column3: This article is part of TIMES EXPRESS.

column2: MOUNTAINOUS ROOFTOP ADDITION DRAWS NOTICE IN BEIJING
column3: It is a condensed version of a story that will appear in tomorrow’s New York Times.

column2: MOUNTAINOUS ROOFTOP ADDITION DRAWS NOTICE IN BEIJING
MOUNTAINOUS ROOFTOP ADDITION DRAWS NOTICE IN BEIJING
column3: BEIJING - In a city brimming with look-at-me architecture, the sprawling addition that Zhang Biqing, a health care magnate, built atop his 26th-floor apartment is a showstopper.

column2: MOUNTAINOUS ROOFTOP ADDITION DRAWS NOTICE IN BEIJING
column3: Constructed with ersatz boulders, crisscrossed by trellises and walkways and dotted with the occasional shrub, the two-story aerie resembles the idealized mountains depicted in classical Chinese paintings - except the requisite lonely monk of yore has been replaced by a flashy karaoke parlor.

column2: MOUNTAINOUS ROOFTOP ADDITION DRAWS NOTICE IN BEIJING
column3: The entire 8,000-square-foot addition, as it turns out, is illegal.

column2: MOUNTAINOUS ROOFTOP ADDITION DRAWS NOTICE IN BEIJING
column3: On Monday, The Beijing Morning News featured a front-page photograph of Zhang’s garish rooftop expansion, along with disturbing accounts of how the well-connected entrepreneur blithely ignored his neighbors’ complaints during the six years he spent creating his craggy villa atop a luxury gated complex in western Beijing.

column2: MOUNTAINOUS ROOFTOP ADDITION DRAWS NOTICE IN BEIJING
column3: Tenants were so tortured by the din of nonstop construction - and the resulting leaks and cracked walls - that several of them sold their apartments and moved out.

column2: MOUNTAINOUS ROOFTOP ADDITION DRAWS NOTICE IN BEIJING
column3: One next-door neighbor was reportedly beaten up after he confronted Zhang about the project, which is said to have cost more than $4 million.

column2: MOUNTAINOUS ROOFTOP ADDITION DRAWS NOTICE IN BEIJING
column3: The story, zealously covered by much of the Chinese news media on Tuesday, seemed to embody the popular perception that the rich and powerful can simply do as they please.

column2: MOUNTAINOUS ROOFTOP ADDITION DRAWS NOTICE IN BEIJING
column3: According to news reports, Zhang amassed a fortune through a chain of traditional Chinese medicine clinics he owned, or through private acupuncture sessions.

column2: MOUNTAINOUS ROOFTOP ADDITION DRAWS NOTICE IN BEIJING
column3: Until recently, he was a local delegate to the Chinese People’s Political Consultative Conference, an advisory body to the ruling Communist Party.

column2: MOUNTAINOUS ROOFTOP ADDITION DRAWS NOTICE IN BEIJING
column3: Code enforcement officials said they were stymied by Zhang’s refusal to let them into his apartment.

column2: MOUNTAINOUS ROOFTOP ADDITION DRAWS NOTICE IN BEIJING
column3: The deputy head of the Purple Bamboo Park urban management district said he even dispatched inspectors to the building’s underground parking garage but Zhang managed to evade them.

column2: MOUNTAINOUS ROOFTOP ADDITION DRAWS NOTICE IN BEIJING
column3: “If we can’t calculate the scope of this illegal construction, we can’t issue a notice requiring him to dismantle it,” the official told the paper.

column2: MOUNTAINOUS ROOFTOP ADDITION DRAWS NOTICE IN BEIJING
column3: By Tuesday, however, Zhang appeared to run out of luck.

column2: MOUNTAINOUS ROOFTOP ADDITION DRAWS NOTICE IN BEIJING
column3: Officials slapped a notice on his front door, giving him 15 days to remove the addition or present evidence that it had been legally constructed.

column2: MOUNTAINOUS ROOFTOP ADDITION DRAWS NOTICE IN BEIJING
column3: He claimed the structure was safe in a brief interview Tuesday evening, but conceded that it might have been a folly after all.

column2: MOUNTAINOUS ROOFTOP ADDITION DRAWS NOTICE IN BEIJING
column3: “Now I realize it was a huge mistake,” he said, adding that he would dismantle the addition within a week.

column2: CANADA'S LARGEST GROCER TO BUY COUNTRY'S BIGGEST PHARMACY CHAIN
column3: OTTAWA - Loblaw Cos. Ltd., Canada’s largest grocer, said Monday that it would acquire Shoppers Drug Mart, the country’s biggest pharmacy chain, for $11.9 billion in cash and stock.

column2: CANADA'S LARGEST GROCER TO BUY COUNTRY'S BIGGEST PHARMACY CHAIN
column3: Family-owned Loblaw is facing several challenges to its core business.

column2: CANADA'S LARGEST GROCER TO BUY COUNTRY'S BIGGEST PHARMACY CHAIN
column3: Last month, Sobeys, another family-owned grocery store chain, acquired the Canadian stores of Safeway for $5.8 billion in cash.

column2: CANADA'S LARGEST GROCER TO BUY COUNTRY'S BIGGEST PHARMACY CHAIN
column3: Target is opening its first Canadian stores, many of which include extensive grocery sections.

column2: CANADA'S LARGEST GROCER TO BUY COUNTRY'S BIGGEST PHARMACY CHAIN
column3: And Wal-Mart Canada has been enlarging food departments at many of its stores.

column2: CANADA'S LARGEST GROCER TO BUY COUNTRY'S BIGGEST PHARMACY CHAIN
column3: Loblaw will exchange the equivalent of 33.18 Canadian dollars in cash and 0.5965 of a common share for each Shoppers Drug Mart share.

column2: CANADA'S LARGEST GROCER TO BUY COUNTRY'S BIGGEST PHARMACY CHAIN
column3: The grocery chain said the combined value was 61.54 Canadian dollars, or $59.05, a 29.4 percent premium to the average share price of the drug chain over the last 20 days.

column2: CANADA'S LARGEST GROCER TO BUY COUNTRY'S BIGGEST PHARMACY CHAIN
column3: The deal is the largest transaction between two Canadian companies since 2009, when Suncor Energy bought Petro-Canada for $15 billion.

column2: CANADA'S LARGEST GROCER TO BUY COUNTRY'S BIGGEST PHARMACY CHAIN
column3: Under the current plan, Shoppers Drug Mart shareholders can choose either 61.54 Canadian dollars in cash or 1.29417 Loblaw shares plus one Canadian cent for each of their shares.

column2: CANADA'S LARGEST GROCER TO BUY COUNTRY'S BIGGEST PHARMACY CHAIN
column3: Shoppers Drug Mart shareholders would own 29 percent of the combined company.

column2: CANADA'S LARGEST GROCER TO BUY COUNTRY'S BIGGEST PHARMACY CHAIN
column3: In a news conference, Galen G. Weston, executive chairman of Loblaw, said that while the two companies had spoken informally over the years, he proposed the transaction to Holger Kluge, the chairman of Shoppers, during a meeting “in a minivan on a country road on Thursday morning.” The unusual venue appears to be the result of Kluge’s attending an out-of-office meeting.

column2: CANADA'S LARGEST GROCER TO BUY COUNTRY'S BIGGEST PHARMACY CHAIN
column3: Weston said repeatedly that the transaction was part of a “vision that combined health, wellness and nutrition” for the company.

column2: CANADA'S LARGEST GROCER TO BUY COUNTRY'S BIGGEST PHARMACY CHAIN
column3: Loblaw, which has long been associated with high-margin, high-quality house brand merchandise, has been promoting a line of products it says are more healthful and posting extensive nutritional information in stores.

column2: CANADA'S LARGEST GROCER TO BUY COUNTRY'S BIGGEST PHARMACY CHAIN
column3: Loblaw said it planned to use its distribution network and grocery-buying power to improve the food sections at Shoppers stores, which have been greatly expanded in recent years.

column2: CANADA'S LARGEST GROCER TO BUY COUNTRY'S BIGGEST PHARMACY CHAIN
column3: Those sections will eventually start carrying Loblaw’s “President’s Choice” house brand line of products as well as more fresh food.

column2: CANADA'S LARGEST GROCER TO BUY COUNTRY'S BIGGEST PHARMACY CHAIN
column3: Domenic Pilla, president and chief executive of Shoppers, will manage the pharmacy as a separate unit that will continue to operate under its own brand names, which include Pharmaprix in Quebec.

column2: CANADA'S LARGEST GROCER TO BUY COUNTRY'S BIGGEST PHARMACY CHAIN
column3: The combined company would have revenue of 42 billion Canadian dollars.

column2: CANADA'S LARGEST GROCER TO BUY COUNTRY'S BIGGEST PHARMACY CHAIN
column3: Loblaw’s executives played down potential antitrust concerns, saying their company controls about 5 percent of the Canadian pharmacy business while Shoppers holds 25 percent.

column2: CANADA'S LARGEST GROCER TO BUY COUNTRY'S BIGGEST PHARMACY CHAIN
column3: But David Soberman, a professor of marketing at the Rotman School of Management at the University of Toronto, said there might be problems because the national figures did not reflect the outsized market share of both companies in Ontario, the county’s most populous province.

column2: TRANSOCEAN SHAREHOLDERS OUST CHAIRMAN, BUT REJECT ICAHN DIVIDEND PROPOSAL
column3: Transocean shareholders Friday ousted board chairman J. Michael Talbert and installed one of billionaire investor Carl Icahn’s nominees as a director, but they rejected Icahn’s proposal for a $4-per-share dividend as too risky at a time when the company still faces financial uncertainties from the Gulf of Mexico oil spill.

column2: TRANSOCEAN SHAREHOLDERS OUST CHAIRMAN, BUT REJECT ICAHN DIVIDEND PROPOSAL
column3: According to vote totals announced at the company’s annual meeting in Zug, Switzerland, shareholders chose by a big margin to go with the company’s $2.24-a-share dividend proposal.

column2: TRANSOCEAN SHAREHOLDERS OUST CHAIRMAN, BUT REJECT ICAHN DIVIDEND PROPOSAL
column3: It will be payable in four quarterly installments, set for June, September and December of this year and March of 2014.

column2: TRANSOCEAN SHAREHOLDERS OUST CHAIRMAN, BUT REJECT ICAHN DIVIDEND PROPOSAL
column3: In the vote for directors, shareholders chose Icahn nominee Samuel Merksamer and rejected Talbert, who said this week he would step down before next year’s meeting if he was re-elected.

column2: TRANSOCEAN SHAREHOLDERS OUST CHAIRMAN, BUT REJECT ICAHN DIVIDEND PROPOSAL
column3: Shareholders approved the rest of the company’s director nominees, rejecting Icahn candidates Jose Maria Alapont and John Lipinski.

column2: TRANSOCEAN SHAREHOLDERS OUST CHAIRMAN, BUT REJECT ICAHN DIVIDEND PROPOSAL
column3: CEO Steven Newman said in a telephone interview that the shareholders’ decisions were largely a victory for the company and its goals, and that the dividend vote in particular was ''an overwhelming endorsement.''

column2: TRANSOCEAN SHAREHOLDERS OUST CHAIRMAN, BUT REJECT ICAHN DIVIDEND PROPOSAL
column3: He noted that more than 75 percent of shares voted favored the company’s proposal.

column2: TRANSOCEAN SHAREHOLDERS OUST CHAIRMAN, BUT REJECT ICAHN DIVIDEND PROPOSAL
column3: And he praised the departing board chairman, who also served formerly as CEO.

column2: TRANSOCEAN SHAREHOLDERS OUST CHAIRMAN, BUT REJECT ICAHN DIVIDEND PROPOSAL
column3: ''He has been instrumental in shepherding this company through growth, through an unprecedented industrial crisis and more recently helping the board and the management teams focus on the right priorities,'' Newman said.

column2: TRANSOCEAN SHAREHOLDERS OUST CHAIRMAN, BUT REJECT ICAHN DIVIDEND PROPOSAL
column3: The defeat on the dividend proposal was a big loss for Icahn, who disclosed earlier this year that he had bought a large block of Transocean shares and would pursue change aggressively at the world’s largest offshore drilling contractor.

column2: TRANSOCEAN SHAREHOLDERS OUST CHAIRMAN, BUT REJECT ICAHN DIVIDEND PROPOSAL
column3: But with one of his nominees on the board, he could increase his influence in company decisions in the future.

column2: TRANSOCEAN SHAREHOLDERS OUST CHAIRMAN, BUT REJECT ICAHN DIVIDEND PROPOSAL
column3: Prior to the vote, Icahn had cited the company’s poor stock performance.

column2: TRANSOCEAN SHAREHOLDERS OUST CHAIRMAN, BUT REJECT ICAHN DIVIDEND PROPOSAL
column3: Its share price has dropped by more than a third since the day before an undersea well blew out in 2010 and triggered an explosion on the Transocean-owned Deepwater Horizon rig in the Gulf of Mexico that killed 11 workers.

column2: TRANSOCEAN SHAREHOLDERS OUST CHAIRMAN, BUT REJECT ICAHN DIVIDEND PROPOSAL
column3: The resulting oil spill was the worst offshore spill in U.S. history.

column2: TRANSOCEAN SHAREHOLDERS OUST CHAIRMAN, BUT REJECT ICAHN DIVIDEND PROPOSAL
column3: Transocean shares closed Friday down 70 cents at $54.03 in New York trading.

column2: TRANSOCEAN SHAREHOLDERS OUST CHAIRMAN, BUT REJECT ICAHN DIVIDEND PROPOSAL
column3: Icahn had proposed that shareholders oust directors Talbert, Robert Sprague and Thomas Cason, replacing them with Alapont, former CEO of Federal-Mogul Corp., Merksamer, managing director at Icahn Capital, and Lipinski, CEO and president of CVR Energy.

column2: TRANSOCEAN SHAREHOLDERS OUST CHAIRMAN, BUT REJECT ICAHN DIVIDEND PROPOSAL
column3: Shareholders concurred only in voting out Talbert and electing Merksamer.

column2: TRANSOCEAN SHAREHOLDERS OUST CHAIRMAN, BUT REJECT ICAHN DIVIDEND PROPOSAL
column3: In a statement after the votes were announced, Icahn said he was pleased with the support Merksamer received from shareholders.

column2: TRANSOCEAN SHAREHOLDERS OUST CHAIRMAN, BUT REJECT ICAHN DIVIDEND PROPOSAL
column3: He said he believes shareholders ''sent an unequivocal and vocal message to the incumbent directors and management, by voting out the chairman, that immediate discipline must be brought to all fiscal and capital allocation decisions.''

column2: TRANSOCEAN SHAREHOLDERS OUST CHAIRMAN, BUT REJECT ICAHN DIVIDEND PROPOSAL
column3: He added, ''We expect that the newly constituted board will take prompt action to deliver that sorely needed change.''

column2: TRANSOCEAN SHAREHOLDERS OUST CHAIRMAN, BUT REJECT ICAHN DIVIDEND PROPOSAL
column3: His statement made no mention of the dividend defeat.

column2: TRANSOCEAN SHAREHOLDERS OUST CHAIRMAN, BUT REJECT ICAHN DIVIDEND PROPOSAL
column3: The board’s governance committee will lead the process of selecting a new chairman, but the company did not detail plans for that Friday or give a timetable.

column2: TRANSOCEAN SHAREHOLDERS OUST CHAIRMAN, BUT REJECT ICAHN DIVIDEND PROPOSAL
column3: optional

column2: TRANSOCEAN SHAREHOLDERS OUST CHAIRMAN, BUT REJECT ICAHN DIVIDEND PROPOSAL
column3: Talbert had been a long-time board member of Transocean and former CEO of the company.

column2: TRANSOCEAN SHAREHOLDERS OUST CHAIRMAN, BUT REJECT ICAHN DIVIDEND PROPOSAL
column3: Sprague is an engineer by education who served for years as an executive at Royal Dutch Shell before retiring from the company.

column2: TRANSOCEAN SHAREHOLDERS OUST CHAIRMAN, BUT REJECT ICAHN DIVIDEND PROPOSAL
column3: Cason owns and manages equipment dealership related to the agricultural industry and is a former chief financial officer at oil field services firm Baker Hughes.

column2: TRANSOCEAN SHAREHOLDERS OUST CHAIRMAN, BUT REJECT ICAHN DIVIDEND PROPOSAL
column3: Also at the meeting, Newman was re-elected to the board for a three-year term and company nominee Frederico Curado, who is chief of Brazilian aircraft maker Embraer S.A., was elected to join the board for a three-year term.

column2: STUYVESANT PRINCIPAL, NOW RETIRED, MISHANDLED CHEATING CASE, REPORT SAYS

column2: STUYVESANT PRINCIPAL, NOW RETIRED, MISHANDLED CHEATING CASE, REPORT SAYS
STUYVESANT PRINCIPAL, NOW RETIRED, MISHANDLED CHEATING CASE, REPORT SAYS
column3: NEW YORK - The principal of Stuyvesant High School, one of the city’s top public schools, mishandled the investigation into a large cheating operation there last year from the moment he was tipped off to it until state education officials became aware of it more than a week later, a city report issued Friday said.

column2: STUYVESANT PRINCIPAL, NOW RETIRED, MISHANDLED CHEATING CASE, REPORT SAYS
column3: The principal, Stanley Teitel, retired last summer while the city’s Education Department was investigating his handling of the cheating, which involved more than 60 students using smartphones to receive answers for standardized city and state tests.

column2: STUYVESANT PRINCIPAL, NOW RETIRED, MISHANDLED CHEATING CASE, REPORT SAYS
column3: The report, issued by the Education Department’s Office of Special Investigations, said that after Teitel was tipped off by a student about the cheating, he set up a sting operation to catch the ringleader when he should have tried to pre-emptively thwart the cheating, including by enforcing the citywide ban on phones inside schools.

column2: STUYVESANT PRINCIPAL, NOW RETIRED, MISHANDLED CHEATING CASE, REPORT SAYS
column3: The report said that Teitel and an assistant principal, Randi Damesek, took too long to question students involved and did not report the cheating to state officials until eight days after catching the lead student, when reporters began inquiring about what had happened.

column2: STUYVESANT PRINCIPAL, NOW RETIRED, MISHANDLED CHEATING CASE, REPORT SAYS
column3: “It is the conclusion of this office that due to a lack of foresight, candor and professional judgment, Teitel and Damesek failed to efficiently and effectively carry out the administrative duties entrusted to them during their handling of the 'cheating incident,' of June 2012,” the report said.

column2: STUYVESANT PRINCIPAL, NOW RETIRED, MISHANDLED CHEATING CASE, REPORT SAYS
column3: It recommended that Teitel be barred from future employment in city schools, and the Education Department will follow that recommendation, Erin Hughes, a spokeswoman, said.

column2: STUYVESANT PRINCIPAL, NOW RETIRED, MISHANDLED CHEATING CASE, REPORT SAYS
column3: Teitel said Friday he had not seen the report and would not discuss its contents.

column2: STUYVESANT PRINCIPAL, NOW RETIRED, MISHANDLED CHEATING CASE, REPORT SAYS
column3: “No one sent me a copy of it,” he said, adding, “I am retired.

column2: STUYVESANT PRINCIPAL, NOW RETIRED, MISHANDLED CHEATING CASE, REPORT SAYS
column3: I have been retired for over a year.”

column2: STUYVESANT PRINCIPAL, NOW RETIRED, MISHANDLED CHEATING CASE, REPORT SAYS
column3: Efforts to reach Damesek were unsuccessful.

column2: STUYVESANT PRINCIPAL, NOW RETIRED, MISHANDLED CHEATING CASE, REPORT SAYS
column3: The Education Department will bring disciplinary charges against her and seek her firing “or, at the very minimum, a demotion,” Hughes said.

column2: STUYVESANT PRINCIPAL, NOW RETIRED, MISHANDLED CHEATING CASE, REPORT SAYS
column3: Besides its unflattering portrait of the leadership team at one of the most prestigious high schools in the country, the report also describes a 21st-century example of how students let others peek at their answers.

column2: STUYVESANT PRINCIPAL, NOW RETIRED, MISHANDLED CHEATING CASE, REPORT SAYS
column3: The ringleader, Nayeem Ahsan, referred to as “Student A” in the report, told investigators he used his iPhone to send answers to other students via text messages to “garner good will” among classmates, the report said, and perhaps get help from them in subjects he was weaker in.

column2: STUYVESANT PRINCIPAL, NOW RETIRED, MISHANDLED CHEATING CASE, REPORT SAYS
column3: The number of students involved who received his texts “grew and grew,” according to Ahsan’s account in the report.

column2: STUYVESANT PRINCIPAL, NOW RETIRED, MISHANDLED CHEATING CASE, REPORT SAYS
column3: During the physics Regents exam, he told investigators, he waited until one proctor left the room and was replaced by a lax one who did not walk around.

column2: STUYVESANT PRINCIPAL, NOW RETIRED, MISHANDLED CHEATING CASE, REPORT SAYS
column3: Eventually, she fell asleep, he said, and he began sending out answers.

column2: STUYVESANT PRINCIPAL, NOW RETIRED, MISHANDLED CHEATING CASE, REPORT SAYS
column3: The proctor denied falling asleep.

column2: STUYVESANT PRINCIPAL, NOW RETIRED, MISHANDLED CHEATING CASE, REPORT SAYS
column3: On June 16, a student emailed Teitel to say that Ahsan had “electronically assisted” several students on Regents exams and was set to do so again, the report said.

column2: STUYVESANT PRINCIPAL, NOW RETIRED, MISHANDLED CHEATING CASE, REPORT SAYS
column3: In reaction to that message, Teitel “showed an extreme lack of judgment,” it said.

column2: STUYVESANT PRINCIPAL, NOW RETIRED, MISHANDLED CHEATING CASE, REPORT SAYS
column3: He set up a sting operation for a June 18 language exam, placing a reliable proctor to catch Ahsan in the act, the report said.

column2: STUYVESANT PRINCIPAL, NOW RETIRED, MISHANDLED CHEATING CASE, REPORT SAYS
column3: When the proctor did so, he notified Teitel, who took Ahsan and his phone out of the room.

column2: STUYVESANT PRINCIPAL, NOW RETIRED, MISHANDLED CHEATING CASE, REPORT SAYS
column3: School staff members copied information from the phone to find out who else had been receiving answers.

column2: STUYVESANT PRINCIPAL, NOW RETIRED, MISHANDLED CHEATING CASE, REPORT SAYS
column3: Shortly after Ahsan left, the information on his phone suddenly disappeared; he told school staff members that he had just suspended his phone service, which they did not believe, the report said.

column2: STUYVESANT PRINCIPAL, NOW RETIRED, MISHANDLED CHEATING CASE, REPORT SAYS
column3: Teitel told Ahsan and his father, “There’s no way I’m keeping him” at Stuyvesant and told them to request a safety-related transfer to another school, which they reluctantly did, but education officials rejected it, saying his safety was not in jeopardy.

column2: STUYVESANT PRINCIPAL, NOW RETIRED, MISHANDLED CHEATING CASE, REPORT SAYS
column3: Dozens of students were suspended for several days and had to retake exams.

column2: STUYVESANT PRINCIPAL, NOW RETIRED, MISHANDLED CHEATING CASE, REPORT SAYS
column3: Nayeem spent his senior year at Forest Hills High School in Queens and graduated two months ago, according to his father.

column2: STUYVESANT PRINCIPAL, NOW RETIRED, MISHANDLED CHEATING CASE, REPORT SAYS
column3: Although the report is dated Nov. 5, its release was delayed until Friday, “because there were allegations of a 'culture of cheating,'” at Stuyvesant, Hughes said.

column2: STUYVESANT PRINCIPAL, NOW RETIRED, MISHANDLED CHEATING CASE, REPORT SAYS
column3: “We kept the investigation open and monitored until the end of the school year,” Hughes said.

column2: STUYVESANT PRINCIPAL, NOW RETIRED, MISHANDLED CHEATING CASE, REPORT SAYS
column3: “No further evidence was presented that warranted a change in the report, so the report was issued as is.”

column2: CZECH PROSECUTORS PREPARE TO CHARGE EX-PREMIER
column3: PARIS - Czech prosecutors asked the Parliament on Monday to strip former Prime Minister Petr Necas of immunity from prosecution.

column2: CZECH PROSECUTORS PREPARE TO CHARGE EX-PREMIER
column3: Law enforcement officials said the request was a prelude to charging Necas with corruption.

column2: CZECH PROSECUTORS PREPARE TO CHARGE EX-PREMIER
column3: Necas would be the highest-level official to face corruption charges in the country since the fall of communism.

column2: CZECH PROSECUTORS PREPARE TO CHARGE EX-PREMIER
column3: A bookish, churchgoing father of four, Necas came to power in 2010 promising to clean up a culture of cronyism and corruption, but he was forced to resign last month after his chief of staff was charged with bribery and abuse of office.

column2: CZECH PROSECUTORS PREPARE TO CHARGE EX-PREMIER
column3: The chief of staff - Jana Nagyova, a close confidante of Necas - is accused of ordering the secret services to spy on Necas’ estranged wife, whom he is divorcing.

column2: CZECH PROSECUTORS PREPARE TO CHARGE EX-PREMIER
column3: Nagyova has also been charged with offering bribes in the form of posts at state-owned companies to three members of Parliament who opposed a government austerity plan.

column2: CZECH PROSECUTORS PREPARE TO CHARGE EX-PREMIER
column3: Prosecutors said they were examining whether Necas had links to the bribery scheme, which some analysts and supporters of Necas have dismissed as the routine trading of political favors rather than a criminal act.

column2: CZECH PROSECUTORS PREPARE TO CHARGE EX-PREMIER
column3: Necas said Monday that no agreement had been made with the three lawmakers, and that, in any case, political agreements could not be considered crimes.

column2: CZECH PROSECUTORS PREPARE TO CHARGE EX-PREMIER
column3: “It is not clear to me what I should be charged with,” he said in a statement.

column2: CZECH PROSECUTORS PREPARE TO CHARGE EX-PREMIER
column3: “So far, all the information we have shows that this whole case is about criminalizing political decisions.

column2: CZECH PROSECUTORS PREPARE TO CHARGE EX-PREMIER
column3: I refuse this approach.

column2: CZECH PROSECUTORS PREPARE TO CHARGE EX-PREMIER
column3: I find it unacceptable and I shall not accept it.

column2: CZECH PROSECUTORS PREPARE TO CHARGE EX-PREMIER
column3: I am ready to defend myself.”

column2: CZECH PROSECUTORS PREPARE TO CHARGE EX-PREMIER
column3: Jindrich Sidlo, a commentator for Hospodarske Noviny, a leading economic newspaper, said on Monday that going ahead with charges in the case would turn Czech politics upside down.

column2: CZECH PROSECUTORS PREPARE TO CHARGE EX-PREMIER
column3: “If this political deal is bribery, then this would be the end of politics in the Czech Republic as we have known it for the past 20 years,” he said by telephone from Prague.

column2: CZECH PROSECUTORS PREPARE TO CHARGE EX-PREMIER
column3: But Ivo Istvan, the chief prosecutor in the case, said that using a state job to entice a lawmaker to resign did constitute bribery, no different than offering a briefcase full of money.

column2: CZECH PROSECUTORS PREPARE TO CHARGE EX-PREMIER
column3: “If a member of Parliament does not act in the public interest in order to be awarded a state job, we can speak about political corruption,” Istvan said.

column2: CZECH PROSECUTORS PREPARE TO CHARGE EX-PREMIER
column3: “We need to ask if Parliament is a place where parliamentarians vote according to their conscience or according to what it can buy them.”

column2: CZECH PROSECUTORS PREPARE TO CHARGE EX-PREMIER
column3: The parliamentary committee that deals with immunity is scheduled to discuss the case July 17, with a vote by the full Parliament expected to take place in September.

column2: CZECH PROSECUTORS PREPARE TO CHARGE EX-PREMIER
column3: Analysts said it was difficult to predict the outcome.

column2: CZECH PROSECUTORS PREPARE TO CHARGE EX-PREMIER
column3: President Milos Zeman has appointed Jiri Rusnok, a leftist former finance minister, to replace Necas.

column2: CZECH PROSECUTORS PREPARE TO CHARGE EX-PREMIER
column3: Zeman is expected to approve Rusnok’s Cabinet on Wednesday, with a vote of confidence in Parliament to follow within 30 days.

column2: SAN DIEGO MAYOR RESIGNS IN SEXUAL HARASSMENT SCANDAL
SAN DIEGO MAYOR RESIGNS IN SEXUAL HARASSMENT SCANDAL
column3: SAN DIEGO - Mayor Bob Filner resigned Friday under a barrage of sexual harassment complaints, offering an apology to his accusers while still denying the allegations and blaming his downfall on “a combination of awkwardness and hubris.”

column2: SAN DIEGO MAYOR RESIGNS IN SEXUAL HARASSMENT SCANDAL
column3: “I never intended to be a mayor who went out like this,” Filner said before a packed City Council chamber, drawing sporadic applause from some supporters in the audience.

column2: SAN DIEGO MAYOR RESIGNS IN SEXUAL HARASSMENT SCANDAL
column3: His announcement came after a closed-door meeting of the City Council in which members considered a deal struck late Wednesday that paved the way for the mayor’s resignation.

column2: SAN DIEGO MAYOR RESIGNS IN SEXUAL HARASSMENT SCANDAL
column3: He is to step down Aug. 30.

column2: SAN DIEGO MAYOR RESIGNS IN SEXUAL HARASSMENT SCANDAL
column3: “This is the toughest decision in my life,” said Filner, who devoted many of his comments to criticizing his political enemies and speaking of the vision he had for leading the city.

column2: SAN DIEGO MAYOR RESIGNS IN SEXUAL HARASSMENT SCANDAL
column3: The council’s decision came after dozens of people packed the chambers to voice their opinion on a deal whose details they had no way of knowing.

column2: SAN DIEGO MAYOR RESIGNS IN SEXUAL HARASSMENT SCANDAL
column3: Several residents supporting a recall effort urged council members to reject any deal that would give Filner money for his legal fees and damages.

column2: SAN DIEGO MAYOR RESIGNS IN SEXUAL HARASSMENT SCANDAL
column3: But others sought compassion for Filner, citing his years of championing civil rights and the environment.

column2: SAN DIEGO MAYOR RESIGNS IN SEXUAL HARASSMENT SCANDAL
column3: The resignation capped a tumultuous six weeks for San Diego.

column2: SAN DIEGO MAYOR RESIGNS IN SEXUAL HARASSMENT SCANDAL
column3: Since Filner’s top communication aide first went public with her complaints of sexual harassment last month, 17 more women came forward with accusations against him.

column2: SAN DIEGO MAYOR RESIGNS IN SEXUAL HARASSMENT SCANDAL
column3: The women who said they were harassed included a retired Navy rear admiral, a great-grandmother, a university dean and the former communications director, Irene McCormack Jackson, who filed a sexual harassment lawsuit against the mayor and the city.

column2: SAN DIEGO MAYOR RESIGNS IN SEXUAL HARASSMENT SCANDAL
column3: Filner eventually apologized for what he called disrespectful behavior, but maintained that he had not broken any laws and that he wanted an impartial review of his actions to clear his name.

column2: SAN DIEGO MAYOR RESIGNS IN SEXUAL HARASSMENT SCANDAL
column3: His lawyers filed papers in court to move the lawsuit against him to Imperial County, just east of San Diego.

column2: SAN DIEGO MAYOR RESIGNS IN SEXUAL HARASSMENT SCANDAL
column3: But calls for his resignation grew louder in recent weeks and organizers on Sunday started collecting signatures to force a recall election against him.

column2: SAN DIEGO MAYOR RESIGNS IN SEXUAL HARASSMENT SCANDAL
column3: Organizers of the recall effort said Friday that they had more than 20,000 signatures, about one-fifth of what would be needed to qualify for the ballot.

column2: SAN DIEGO MAYOR RESIGNS IN SEXUAL HARASSMENT SCANDAL
column3: Todd Gloria, the Democratic City Council president, who was part of the negotiations, will serve as acting mayor until a special election is held in the next 90 days.

column2: MERGER OF PENGUIN AND RANDOM HOUSE IS COMPLETED
MERGER OF PENGUIN AND RANDOM HOUSE IS COMPLETED
column3: Random House and Penguin completed their planned merger Monday, creating the biggest and most powerful book publisher in the world.

column2: MERGER OF PENGUIN AND RANDOM HOUSE IS COMPLETED
column3: The new company, called Penguin Random House, will control more than 25 percent of the U.S. trade book market, giving it unmatched leverage against Amazon.com, a growing force in the industry.

column2: MERGER OF PENGUIN AND RANDOM HOUSE IS COMPLETED
column3: Bertelsmann, the owner of Random House, and Pearson, the owner of Penguin, announced the merger in October, saying that Bertelsmann would control 53 percent of the company and Penguin 47 percent.

column2: MERGER OF PENGUIN AND RANDOM HOUSE IS COMPLETED
column3: Since then, the merger has sailed through regulatory approvals in the United States and Europe, as well as China, Canada and other countries.

column2: MERGER OF PENGUIN AND RANDOM HOUSE IS COMPLETED
column3: The new company would have more than 10,000 employees, 250 independent publishing imprints and about $3.9 billion in annual revenues.

column2: MERGER OF PENGUIN AND RANDOM HOUSE IS COMPLETED
column3: Markus Dohle, the chairman and chief executive of Random House who will take on the role of chief executive of the new company, announced the finalization of the merger in an email to employees Monday.

column2: MERGER OF PENGUIN AND RANDOM HOUSE IS COMPLETED
column3: “Today, we are Penguin Random House,” he wrote.

column2: MERGER OF PENGUIN AND RANDOM HOUSE IS COMPLETED
column3: “You should be proud of what you’ve accomplished and what we are all now a part of: the first truly global trade book publishing company.

column2: MERGER OF PENGUIN AND RANDOM HOUSE IS COMPLETED
column3: Together, we are even better positioned to fulfill our core purpose: to bridge authors and readers by publishing the very best books.”

column2: MERGER OF PENGUIN AND RANDOM HOUSE IS COMPLETED
column3: Bertelsmann acquired Random House in 1998 for more than $1 billion.

column2: MERGER OF PENGUIN AND RANDOM HOUSE IS COMPLETED
column3: David Shanks, the chief executive of Penguin Group USA, has stepped down and will be a senior adviser to Dohle and the executive team, Dohle said in his letter to employees.

column2: MERGER OF PENGUIN AND RANDOM HOUSE IS COMPLETED
column3: John Makinson, the head of Penguin Group since 2002, will be the chairman of Penguin Random House.

column2: MERGER OF PENGUIN AND RANDOM HOUSE IS COMPLETED
column3: “Penguin Random House starts life today as a freshly minted company, but also as a creative enterprise that will draw on the greatest legacies in the history of book publishing,” Makinson said in a statement.

column2: MERGER OF PENGUIN AND RANDOM HOUSE IS COMPLETED
column3: Over the last several months, executives at both companies have sought to assure employees on the publishing side that it will be business as usual.

column2: MERGER OF PENGUIN AND RANDOM HOUSE IS COMPLETED
column3: There are no immediate plans for laying off employees or shuttering imprints.

column2: MERGER OF PENGUIN AND RANDOM HOUSE IS COMPLETED
column3: Executives at Penguin and Random House said the initial focus would be on unifying the infrastructure of the companies, including establishing pay scales, health benefits and new email addresses.

column2: MERGER OF PENGUIN AND RANDOM HOUSE IS COMPLETED
column3: There will also be an effort to sort out redundancies.

column2: MERGER OF PENGUIN AND RANDOM HOUSE IS COMPLETED
column3: As physical book sales decrease, so does the need for gigantic warehouses to store and ship books; the newly combined company is likely to find ways to trim printing, distribution and storage costs.

column2: LAW FIRMS ORRICK AND PILLSBURY IN MERGER TALKS
column3: The law firms Orrick Herrington & Sutcliffe and Pillsbury Winthrop Shaw Pittman are in advanced merger talks, with an announcement of a deal expected as early as next week.

column2: LAW FIRMS ORRICK AND PILLSBURY IN MERGER TALKS
column3: A combination would create one of the country’s 10 largest firms with about 1,700 lawyers.

column2: LAW FIRMS ORRICK AND PILLSBURY IN MERGER TALKS
column3: The discussions underscore the pressure on corporate law firms to grow their businesses amid persistently soft demand for legal services and the increasing globalization of the corporate law industry.

column2: LAW FIRMS ORRICK AND PILLSBURY IN MERGER TALKS
column3: “Our firms are in exploratory discussions about a possible combination,” James Rishwain, the chairman of Pillsbury, and Mitch Zuklie, the chairman of Orrick, said in a joint statement.

column2: LAW FIRMS ORRICK AND PILLSBURY IN MERGER TALKS
column3: “These talks are serving to confirm the great respect our firms have for each other.”

column2: LAW FIRMS ORRICK AND PILLSBURY IN MERGER TALKS
column3: People close to the talks said that the deal could still fall apart but that they were far along.

column2: LAW FIRMS ORRICK AND PILLSBURY IN MERGER TALKS
column3: Typically, the executive committees of each firm agree to the main terms of a merger and then the entire partnerships vote at a later date.

column2: LAW FIRMS ORRICK AND PILLSBURY IN MERGER TALKS
column3: The news was first reported by Reuters.

column2: LAW FIRMS ORRICK AND PILLSBURY IN MERGER TALKS
column3: Mergers among the nation’s 100 largest firms once occurred infrequently, and marriages involving top firms were rarer still.

column2: LAW FIRMS ORRICK AND PILLSBURY IN MERGER TALKS
column3: But today, firms are under pressure to add to their practices quickly to break into new geographic markets and practice areas.

column2: LAW FIRMS ORRICK AND PILLSBURY IN MERGER TALKS
column3: And some legal industry studies have concluded that size matters in corporate law - the larger the firm, the stronger the brand.

column2: LAW FIRMS ORRICK AND PILLSBURY IN MERGER TALKS
column3: Law firm mergers are booming, and a combination of Orrick and Pillsbury would be the year’s largest.

column2: LAW FIRMS ORRICK AND PILLSBURY IN MERGER TALKS
column3: Fifty-eight law firms had announced mergers as of the end of September, a 41 percent increase from the same period last year, according to survey by Altman Weil, a legal industry consulting firm.

column2: LAW FIRMS ORRICK AND PILLSBURY IN MERGER TALKS
column3: In 2012, the large Houston firm, Fulbright & Jaworksi, joined forces with Norton Rose in Britain, creating a firm of nearly 4,000 lawyers.

column2: LAW FIRMS ORRICK AND PILLSBURY IN MERGER TALKS
column3: Dentons, a firm of about 2,500 lawyers, is in talks to acquire McKenna Long & Aldridge in a deal that would push its lawyer count to more than 3,000.

column2: LAW FIRMS ORRICK AND PILLSBURY IN MERGER TALKS
column3: But law firm mergers carry significant risk.

column2: LAW FIRMS ORRICK AND PILLSBURY IN MERGER TALKS
column3: For starters, there is a possibility that the leaking of merger talks can have a destabilizing effect on the firms involved, leading to defections by important partners who may disapprove of a deal or fear a lesser role - or less compensation - at the combined firm.

column2: LAW FIRMS ORRICK AND PILLSBURY IN MERGER TALKS
column3: Big law firm deals have a mixed track record and often result in power struggles and cultural clashes.

column2: LAW FIRMS ORRICK AND PILLSBURY IN MERGER TALKS
column3: Most infamously, the 2007 merger of Dewey Ballantine and LeBoeuf Lamb Greene & MacRae - the largest merger of New York law firms in history - was a fiasco.

column2: LAW FIRMS ORRICK AND PILLSBURY IN MERGER TALKS
column3: Last year, the combined firm, Dewey & LeBoeuf, collapsed in bankruptcy amid financial mismanagement and partner defections.

column2: LAW FIRMS ORRICK AND PILLSBURY IN MERGER TALKS
column3: In 2006, Orrick had flirted with possible disaster when it had agreed to the main terms of a combination with Dewey Ballantine, but the deal fell apart after several top partners jumped ship when merger talks were leaked.

column2: LAW FIRMS ORRICK AND PILLSBURY IN MERGER TALKS
column3: Orrick, with 1,100 lawyers, has talked with several firms over the past decade but never made it to the altar.

column2: LAW FIRMS ORRICK AND PILLSBURY IN MERGER TALKS
column3: Pillsbury, too, recently discussed a deal with Fulbright.

column2: LAW FIRMS ORRICK AND PILLSBURY IN MERGER TALKS
column3: Although today each has offices across the globe, both Orrick’s and Pillsbury’s historical roots are firmly grounded on the West Coast.

column2: LAW FIRMS ORRICK AND PILLSBURY IN MERGER TALKS
column3: Each was started in San Francisco in the 1860s in the wake of the California gold rush.

column2: LAW FIRMS ORRICK AND PILLSBURY IN MERGER TALKS
column3: A merger would create a formidable presence in Silicon Valley, which has become an area of expansion for corporate firms.

column2: LAW FIRMS ORRICK AND PILLSBURY IN MERGER TALKS
column3: In Washington, Pillsbury has an especially strong nuclear energy practice, another hot practice area.

column2: AMERICAN INMATE IN NORTH KOREA ASKS FOR HIGH-LEVEL U.S. VISIT
column3: SEOUL, South Korea - An American tour operator imprisoned in North Korea on charges of plotting to harm the Socialist country through Christian missionary activities has appealed to Washington to send a high-ranking official to North Korea to help free him, according to a videotaped interview made public Tuesday.

column2: AMERICAN INMATE IN NORTH KOREA ASKS FOR HIGH-LEVEL U.S. VISIT
column3: The Choson Sinbo, a pro-North Korean newspaper based in Japan, on Tuesday posted the video footage of tour operator, Kenneth Bae, a Korean-American from Washington state, sitting in a hospital in the North Korean capital, Pyongyang, where he was moved from a labor camp a week ago as his health deteriorated.

column2: AMERICAN INMATE IN NORTH KOREA ASKS FOR HIGH-LEVEL U.S. VISIT
column3: Bae, 45, had been imprisoned at the camp since May, shortly after he was sentenced to 15 years of hard labor for what North Korean authorities said were hostile acts against the government.

column2: AMERICAN INMATE IN NORTH KOREA ASKS FOR HIGH-LEVEL U.S. VISIT
column3: Bae was leading a group of visitors from China into the special economic zone of Rason in northeastern North Korea when he was arrested in November.

column2: AMERICAN INMATE IN NORTH KOREA ASKS FOR HIGH-LEVEL U.S. VISIT
column3: North Korean officials accused Bae of being a Christian missionary who flouted the country’s laws on proselytizing.

column2: AMERICAN INMATE IN NORTH KOREA ASKS FOR HIGH-LEVEL U.S. VISIT
column3: In his interview with The Choson Sinbo, Bae said he had “violated” North Korean laws.

column2: AMERICAN INMATE IN NORTH KOREA ASKS FOR HIGH-LEVEL U.S. VISIT
column3: “As an American citizen, I request the U.S. government to make active efforts so I can be pardoned and return home,” he said in the interview, which The Choson Sinbo said took place Friday.

column3: SEOUL, South Korea - South Korean factory managers returned Wednesday to a shuttered industrial park in North Korea for the first time in two months, as the two governments resumed talks on reopening the complex, once a symbol of inter-Korean economic cooperation.

column2: SOUTH KOREAN MANAGERS RETURN TO SHUTTERED PLANT IN NORTH
column3: The managers inspected their manufacturing equipment before the possible resumption of operations.

column3: More managers planned to visit Kaesong on Thursday.

column2: SOUTH KOREAN MANAGERS RETURN TO SHUTTERED PLANT IN NORTH

column2: SOUTH KOREAN MANAGERS RETURN TO SHUTTERED PLANT IN NORTH

column2: ROSALIA MERA, 69, CO-FOUNDER OF ZARA

column2: ALLEGED ITALIAN MOB BOSS IS DENIED BAIL IN BRITAIN
column3: A British judge denied him bail Friday, two days after his arrest on an international warrant seeking his extradition to Italy to serve a seven-year sentence for extortion and other crimes.

column2: ALLEGED ITALIAN MOB BOSS IS DENIED BAIL IN BRITAIN
column3: Right until the brief court hearing Friday, there had been speculation that he would be freed because of technical flaws in the warrant.

column2: ALLEGED ITALIAN MOB BOSS IS DENIED BAIL IN BRITAIN
column3: At a separate hearing the day before, Judge Quentin Purdy of Westminster Magistrates’ Court said, “There are concerns about the validity of the warrant that has come before the court.”

column2: ALLEGED ITALIAN MOB BOSS IS DENIED BAIL IN BRITAIN
column3: But Friday, while Rancadore, 64, was still in a police holding cell, a new warrant was issued.

column2: ALLEGED ITALIAN MOB BOSS IS DENIED BAIL IN BRITAIN
column3: At the court hearing later, Purdy denied his bail request, meaning that Rancadore will remain in custody while he awaits extradition proceedings.

column2: ALLEGED ITALIAN MOB BOSS IS DENIED BAIL IN BRITAIN
column3: According to court filings in London, Rancadore was sentenced in 1999 to seven years in prison after being tried in absentia and convicted of extortion, membership in the Mafia and other serious crimes.

column2: ALLEGED ITALIAN MOB BOSS IS DENIED BAIL IN BRITAIN
column3: The Italian authorities placed him on a list of “dangerous fugitives,” the Italian Interior Ministry said, because he had been a “man of honor” in Cosa Nostra.

column2: ALLEGED ITALIAN MOB BOSS IS DENIED BAIL IN BRITAIN
column3: As a top Mafia member, the Italian authorities said, Rancadore went by the sobriquet U Profissuri, the professor, from a Mafia clan in Trabia near Palermo, the Sicilian capital.

column3: Italian investigators believe that Rancadore fled Italy in the early 1990s because of an internal conflict, when the “boss of all bosses,” Salvatore Riina, ordered the killing of two top anti-Mafia prosecutors.
